thread.title: Rio Ferdinand proves he's DEFINITELY a Manchester United fan - Michael Owen not so much
thread.title_full: Rio Ferdinand proves he's DEFINITELY a Manchester United fan - Michael Owen not so much

author: Jake Polden
title: Rio Ferdinand proves he's DEFINITELY a Manchester United fan - Michael Owen not so much
text:
Get daily   Thank you for subscribing!   
If you were unsure just how much Manchester United means to Rio Ferdinand then take a look at the above video. 
The clip shows the former Red Devils centre-back watching United's clash with Liverpool, moments after Zlatan Ibrahimovic equalised for the home team. 
There was some suspicion as to whether Antonio Valencia was in an offside position in the build-up to the goal - even Gary Neville was unsure in his Sky Sports commentary. 
But was it offside? Definitely not according to Ferdinand, who was absolutely delighted to see his former side draw level with their bitter rivals. Rio Ferdinand was pleased to see Zlatan Ibrahimovic equalise (Photo: Michael Regan) Ferdinand is definitely a Manchester United fan 
Now if there is one person who has had an interesting relationship with United, then it is Liverpool's boy prodigy Michael Owen. 
The 37-year-old spent eight years at Anfield, but of course was on the books at Old Trafford for three years in the latter part of his career. 
Being biased towards either team is therefore a little harder for Owen, who also makes this clear in the above video, disagreeing with the ex-defender's onside call. Michael Owen was on the books at Old Trafford for three seasons (Photo: Tom Purslow/Manchester United via Getty Images) Liverpool's Owen scores past Man United's Peter Schmeichel (Photo: Daily Mirror) 
This video is not the only time today Ferdinand showed his true colours ahead of the massive derby game at Old Trafford. 
The 38-year-old posted a clip online earlier in which he tipped Wayne Rooney to break Sir Bobby Charlton's club goal-scoring record. poll loading Should Rio Ferdinand join Manchester United's coaching staff? 1000+ VOTES SO FAR
